required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Dermabond PRINEO for Total Shoulder Arthroplasty
clinical_study.official_title: Investigation of a New Skin Closure Device, Dermabond PRINEO, for Total Shoulder Arthroplasty: A Randomized, Controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock: This is a research study to find out whether wound closure (the process of closing the surgical wound after the procedure is complete) with Dermabond PRINEO Skin Closure System (PRINEO) will be faster and improve wound healing compared to standard closing methods after total shoulder replacement. The PRINEO system involves using running stitches to close the wound, and then taping over the sutures with a sticky film that holds the wound closed.

primary_outcome.measure: Comparison of the Total Cost of Wound Closure When Using Dermabond PRINEO Versus the Surgeon's Control.
primary_outcome.description: Closure cost was calculated by evaluating the cost of wound closure products ($) per patient, plus the cost of the operating room ($) per minute, multiplied by the closure time (minutes) per centimeter of incision length, then multiplied by the average incision length (cm) per patient.

primary_outcome.measure: Comparing Patient Satisfaction Ratings Between D.PRINEO and Controls
primary_outcome.description: Patient satisfaction ratings were on a scale from 0-10, where 0 = very dissatisfied and 10 = very satisfied.

primary_outcome.measure: Mean Closure Time Per Centimeter of Incision
primary_outcome.description: This closure time was measured from the first stitch for closure to the application of the wound dressing. The incision length was measured immediately after closure.

secondary_outcome.measure: Median Overall Opinion Score Reported by Operating Surgeon
secondary_outcome.description: Overall Opinion was on a scale 1 - 10, where lower scores are viewed more favorably with 1=normal skin and 10=very different compared to adjacent skin, which was evaluated by the operating physician.

secondary_outcome.measure: Median Wound Inflammation Score (AIRE) Reported by Operating Physician
secondary_outcome.description: Images of the healing wound will be assessed according to the Acute Inflammatory Response Evaluation score (0 to 3, 0 being the lowest amount of inflammation and 3 represents the highest amount of inflammation) by the operating physician.

secondary_outcome.measure: Median Scar Assessment (POSAS) by Operating Surgeon
secondary_outcome.description: Images of the healing wound will be assessed according to the Patient and Observer Scar Assessment Scale (POSAS, where there are six components each ranging between 1-10 with 10 representing the worst outcome, and each of those six components were summed for these results, having a final range of 6-60) by the operating surgeon.

secondary_outcome.measure: Wound Cosmesis (MHCS) Score by Operating Physician
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluation of the wound after surgery will be assessed according to the Modified Hollander Cosmesis Scale (0 to 6, with 0 being ideal) by the operating physician.

secondary_outcome.measure: Differences Between Patient and Surgeon Total POSAS Scores
secondary_outcome.description: POSAS scores can range from 1-10, where 1 is like normal skin, and 10 is worst scar imaginable, and has six components. Each component (range of 1-10) was summed up to get a final score (range of 6-60) for each participant. Differences were calculated as the participant's Patient and Observer Scar Assessment Scale (POSAS) score minus the physician POSAS score, with a negative difference signifying that the patients thought more highly of the scars than the physicians since lower POSAS scores are more favorable.

secondary_outcome.measure: Median Overall Opinion Score Reported by Plastic Surgeons
secondary_outcome.description: Overall Opinion was on a scale 1 - 10, where lower scores are viewed more favorably with 1=normal skin and 10=very different compared to adjacent skin, which was evaluated by an independent plastic surgeon.

secondary_outcome.measure: Median Scar Assessment (POSAS) by Plastic Surgeon
secondary_outcome.description: Images of the healing wound will be assessed according to the Patient and Observer Scar Assessment Scale (POSAS, includes six measurements ranging from 0 to 10, 10 being ideal, where the total of the six measurements is what is reported) by an independent plastic surgeon. This POSAS total score would then range from 6-60.

secondary_outcome.measure: Wound Cosmesis (MHCS) Score by Plastic Surgeon
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluation of the wound after surgery will be assessed according to the Modified Hollander Cosmesis Scale (0 to 6, with 0 being ideal) by an independent plastic surgeon.

arm_group.description: Subcuticular sutures with traditional Dermabond applied to incision.

intervention.description: This intervention closes incisions after shoulder arthroplasty using subcuticular sutures with Dermabond.The deep layer closure will require interrupted sutures.
This intervention closes incisions after shoulder arthroplasty with metal staples. The deep layer closure will require interrupted sutures,
The closure system uses the Dermabond PRINEO (which is similar to clear tape stuck over the wound) placed over running sutures for both the deep and subcuticular layer.
The closure system uses the Dermabond PRINEO (which is similar to clear tape stuck over the wound) placed over running sutures for both the deep and subcuticular layer.

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

outcome.title: Differences Between Patient and Surgeon Total POSAS Scores
outcome.description: POSAS scores can range from 1-10, where 1 is like normal skin, and 10 is worst scar imaginable, and has six components. Each component (range of 1-10) was summed up to get a final score (range of 6-60) for each participant. Differences were calculated as the participant's Patient and Observer Scar Assessment Scale (POSAS) score minus the physician POSAS score, with a negative difference signifying that the patients thought more highly of the scars than the physicians since lower POSAS scores are more favorable.
outcome.population: Arms were regrouped to reflect the patient and surgeon scores for each intervention. Participants who had adverse events before the conclusion of the study were excluded from this analysis, because outcome measures could not be collected.

group.title: Traditional Dermabond + Subcuticular Sutures - Patient Scores
group.description: Patients that received the subcuticular sutures with traditional Dermabond applied for their incision intervention. Subcuticular Sutures: The intervention closes incisions after shoulder arthroplasty using subcuticular sutures with Dermabond. The deep layer closure will require interrupted sutures.

group.title: Traditional Dermabond + Subcuticular Sutures - Surgeon 1 Scores
group.description: Surgeon 1 scores for patients who received Subcuticular sutures with traditional Dermabond applied to incision.

group.title: Metal Staples - Patient Scores
group.description: Patients that received the metal staples intervention for their wound closure. Metal Staples: This intervention closes incisions after shoulder arthroplasty with metal staples. The deep layer closure will require interrupted sutures.

group.title: Metal Staples - Surgeon 2 Scores
group.description: Surgeon 2 Scores for patients that received metal staples.

group.title: Dermabond PRINEO - Surgeon 1 Patient Scores
group.description: Patients that received the Dermabond PRINEO System intervention for wound closure from Surgeon 1. PRINEO: The closure system uses the Dermabond PRINEO (which is similar to clear tape stuck over the wound) placed over running sutures for both the deep and subcuticular layer.

group.title: Dermabond PRINEO - Surgeon 1 Scores
group.description: Surgeon 1 Scores for patients that received the Dermabond PRINEO closure system.

group.title: Dermabond PRINEO - Surgeon 2 Patient Scores
group.description: Patients that received the Dermabond PRINEO System intervention wound closure from Surgeon 2. PRINEO: The closure system uses the Dermabond PRINEO (which is similar to clear tape stuck over the wound) placed over running sutures for both the deep and subcuticular layer.

group.title: Dermabond PRINEO - Surgeon 2 Scores
group.description: Surgeon 2 Scores for patients that received the Dermabond PRINEO closure system.

measure.title: Differences Between Patient and Surgeon Total POSAS Scores
measure.description: POSAS scores can range from 1-10, where 1 is like normal skin, and 10 is worst scar imaginable, and has six components. Each component (range of 1-10) was summed up to get a final score (range of 6-60) for each participant. Differences were calculated as the participant's Patient and Observer Scar Assessment Scale (POSAS) score minus the physician POSAS score, with a negative difference signifying that the patients thought more highly of the scars than the physicians since lower POSAS scores are more favorable.
measure.population: Arms were regrouped to reflect the patient and surgeon scores for each intervention. Participants who had adverse events before the conclusion of the study were excluded from this analysis, because outcome measures could not be collected.

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: The statistical significance's p-value was set at 0.05. For Surgeon 1's differences, they were calculated as patient POSAS score - surgeon POSAS score, with a negative difference signifying that the patients thought more highly of the scars than the physicians since lower POSAS scores are more favorable.

The statistical significance's p-value was set at 0.05. For Surgeon 2's differences, they were calculated as patient POSAS score - surgeon POSAS score, with a negative difference signifying that the patients thought more highly of the scars than the physicians since lower POSAS scores are more favorable.

outcome.title: Median Overall Opinion Score Reported by Plastic Surgeons
outcome.description: Overall Opinion was on a scale 1 - 10, where lower scores are viewed more favorably with 1=normal skin and 10=very different compared to adjacent skin, which was evaluated by an independent plastic surgeon.
outcome.population: Participants who had adverse events before the conclusion of the study were excluded from this analysis, because outcome measures could not be collected.

reported_events.time_frame: The adverse even data was collected up to 3 months post-operatively.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
